intro: Hydriastele sarasinorum, commonly known as the Sarasin's hydriastele, is a rare epiphytic plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its unique leaf structure and specialized root system. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Hydriastele sarasinorum thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires high atmospheric humidity to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
